metadata.title: CVE-2019-19072 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A memory leak in the predicate_parse() function inkernel/trace/trace_events_filter.c in the Linux kernel through 5.3.11allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), akaCID-96c5c6e6a5b6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19072` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1

No subscription required
